title: Ticket #1230: New ClassAd parser drops character after =!=
description: The parser in new ClassAds will drop the first character after a '=!=' operator. This can lead to an incorrect parse or a parsing failure. In pure new ClassAds, 'isnt' is used instead of '=!='. In places we use new ClassAds in Condor before the dumping of old ClassAds, the unparsed expressions usually have a space after the '=!=', which doesn't cause any problems.
remarks:
2010-Feb-18 14:12:29 by jfrey:
Pushed fix to V7_5_1-branch for 7.5.1 release.
